meanings.definition: Engaged in a physical struggle or fight
meanings.sent1: The two boys were wrassled over the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: The wrassled cat emerged victorious after the intense battle.
meanings.sent3: The wrassled squirrels in the park drew a crowd of amused onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The wrassled warriors fought valiantly in the ancient battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wrassled fighters was etched in everyone's memory.

meanings.definition: Wrestled or grappled with someone in a playful manner
meanings.sent1: The siblings wrassled playfully on the soft grass.
meanings.sent2: The puppies wrassled around, wagging their tails happily.
meanings.sent3: The friends wrassled for fun, laughing all the way.
meanings.sent4: The children wrassled like little bears in the cozy den.
meanings.sent5: The memory of wrassled joy lingered in their hearts.
